definition: To fasten or secure objects together by driving a pointed metal object into them, often with the aid of a tool. This action is commonly performed on surfaces made of wood or other similar materials.

examples.german: Ich habe gestern ein Bild an die Wand genagelt.
examples.english: Yesterday, I nailed a picture to the wall.

examples.german: Der Schreiner hat die Holzbretter miteinander genagelt.
examples.english: The carpenter nailed the wooden boards together.

examples.german: Er hat sich den Finger beim Nageln verletzt.
examples.english: He injured his finger while nailing.

examples.german: Die Schuhe sind mit Nägeln beschlagen.
examples.english: The shoes are studded with nails.

examples.german: Sie hat die Notiz an die Tür genagelt.
examples.english: She nailed the note to the door.
